resources.string: THE JEWISH LEARNING INITIATIVE ON CAMPUS
JLIC was created as a resource for Jewish education through a fulfilling partnership between Hillel and the Orthodox Union.
Sunday Night Learning is a weekly event in which students learn Jewish texts in pairs
The Jewish short story club meets once a month to discuss selected short stories by Jewish authors or pertaining to Jewish themes.
#PennHillel is Hillel’s weekly publication comprised of contributions from members of the Hillel community.
Raymond Habbaz- rhabbaz@sas.upenn.edu and Shlomit Heering- shh447@gmail.com
Penn Hebrew Project is a weekly, peer-to-peer Hebrew tutoring program.
This six-week mini-series offers a foundation of Judaism, bringing participants to engage thoughtfully and deeply with the essential Jewish ideas.
HEC focuses on educating about the tragedy of the Holocaust in an effort to stifle future hatred and intolerance.
Samantha Sharon - sharonsa@sas.upenn.edu and Avi Grunfeld - Grunavi@sas.upenn.edu
OCP Chessed allows students to give of themselves to the Penn Jewish community & the world at large by running various events to benefit local & international charities.
Rebecca Spirgel - rebecca.spirgel@gmail.com and Leora Apfelbaum - lja421@gmail.com
Penn Hillel hosts a Sunday night soup kitchen where volunteers serve food to the community members in need.
Atid matches up Penn students with West Philadelphia high school students for 1-on-1 college access mentoring.
Shayna Golkow - shaynago@sas.upenn.edu and Elana Stern - selana@sas.upenn.edu
JPEG focuses on raising awareness of environmental issues, encouraging sustaibale practices on campus and helping students realize the connection between environmental issues and Judaism.
Students work under the supervision of Project Sunshine to visit patients at the Children\'s Hospital of Philadelphia.
OCP offers a plethora of programs & services for Orthodox Jewish students at Penn and at neighboring schools.
Etan Raskas - eraskas@gmail.com and Daniel Raiken - daniel.raikin@gmail.com
CJC offers Conservatice Shabbat & holiday services as well as various social & educational events for students across campus.
Gregory Segal - grsegal@sas.upenn.edu and Elana Leib - leibel@sas.upenn.edu
RJC hold musical, intimate services and holiday celebrations and fosters an environment that encourages learning and social justice, as well as the exploration of spirituality.
Rachel Eisenberg - erach@sas.upenn.edu and Jacob Ruden - jruden@sas.upenn.edu
Shira Chadasha strives to provide Penn\'s Jewish student body with spirited and inclusive prayer opportunities.
Tamar Friedman - tamarf@sas.upenn.edu and Daniel Blas - danielblas@gmail.com and Joe Step - joestep93@gmail.com
SYQ is a group that embraces Sephardic Jews from all different backgrounds.
Raymond Habbaz - rhabbaz@sas.upenn.edu and Jack Gindi - jgindi@sas.upenn.edu
PIPAC is dedicated to supporting and strengthening the US-Israel alliance through involvement in the American political process.
J-Street is part of a national student movement that aims to change the conversation about Israel, occupation and the peace process on campuses in order to promote a two-state solution.
ICC hosts many fun and exciting events exploring the cultural side of Israel, including engaging speakers, concerts, food outings, movie screenings and more!
Israel@Penn is a student-run Israel education group on Penn\'s campus.
Alexandra Guttman - guttmana@sas.upenn.edu and Daniela Jinich - danielajinich@gmail.com

The TAMID Israel Investment Group connects Penn business-minded students with Israeli economic landscape through a student-led investment fund, consulting projects and the Fellowship Summer Internship Program.
J-Bagel is a Philadelphia-wide student group dedicated to serving members of the LGBTQAI (Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transexual/Transgender, Queer/Questioning, Ally, Intersex) community.
Penn\'s premier Jewish A Capella group.
Adina Goldstein - goadina@sas.upenn.edu and Sarah Beckoff - sbeckoff@wharton.upenn.edu
A community of Jewish students who transferred into Penn.
Shabbat Committee is dedicated to making the Shabbat experience at Penn Hillel as engaging and meaningful as possible.
Hillel\'s Marketing Committee works to advertise Penn Hillel events and opportunities to students.
PennZoremet is Penn\'s Jewish dance troupe.
Aviva Koloski - akoloski@sas.upenn.edu and Hannah Dardashti - dahannah@sas.upenn.edu
